item.title: 矿工开采海床，联合国支持的监管机构与特朗普针锋相对
item.description: 国际监管机构周五谴责了一家海底采矿公司寻求特朗普政府批准从未经开发的海洋生态系统中开采重要矿物，从而规避监管机构权力的行为。【原文：International regulators on Friday condemned a seabed mining company’s move to circumvent their authority by seeking the Trump administration’s approval to extract critical minerals from untouched ocean ecosystems.】

item.title: 美国企业抛弃绿色债券，特朗普为共和党的攻击壮胆
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫以来，美国公司几乎放弃了绿色债券，而这种债券曾被誉为美国企业参与修复地球的一种方式。【原文：Since Donald Trump’s return to the White House, US companies have all but abandoned the green bonds that were once touted as a way for corporate America to have a hand in fixing the planet.】

item.title: 德国电力市场因风力骤降而由天然气发电厂拯救
item.description: 过去十年间，德国新增的陆上风力涡轮机数量超过了任何其他欧洲国家，但本月产量的严重下滑表明，德国的能源系统仍然受到天气和老旧化石燃料发电厂的摆布。【原文：Germany added more onshore wind turbines in the past decade than any other European country, but a severe slump in output this month shows how the nation’s energy system is still at the mercy of the weather and its old fossil-fuel plants.】

item.title: 交通滞后导致 2024 年法国排放量下降速度放缓
item.description: 2024 年，法国温室气体排放量的下降速度低于往年，原因是遏制交通和建筑部门污染的努力滞后。【原文：France’s greenhouse gas emissions fell at a slower pace in 2024 than in previous years as efforts to curb pollution in the transport and building sectors lagged.】

item.title: 荷兰非营利组织指控荷兰国际集团在气候问题上失职
item.description: 一家非营利性环保组织对荷兰国际集团（ING Groep NV）提起诉讼，指控这家荷兰最大的银行在开展业务时未能充分考虑气候变化因素。【原文：An environmental nonprofit has filed a lawsuit against ING Groep NV, alleging that the biggest bank in the Netherlands has failed to conduct its business in a way that adequately takes climate change into account.】

item.title: 今年 COP 的赛前活动中大家都在想什么？
item.description: 今天的时事通讯探讨了标志着联合国年度气候谈判正式开始的一项活动的主要收获。如需不受限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at key takeaways from an event marking the official start to the run-up to annual United Nations climate talks. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: Amundi 推动在即将进行的黎巴嫩债务重组中纳入环境、社会和公司治理内容
item.description: 欧洲最大的资产管理公司 Amundi 计划加大力度，在未来的新兴市场债券重组中纳入可持续发展标准，特别是在黎巴嫩即将进行的 300 亿美元债务重组中。【原文：Europe’s biggest asset manager, Amundi, plans to step up efforts to embed sustainability criteria in future restructurings of emerging-market bonds, notably in Lebanon’s upcoming $30 billion debt overhaul.】

item.title: EQT 为其最新基础设施基金融资 215 亿欧元
item.description: EQT AB 为其最新的基础设施基金筹集了 215 亿欧元（约合 232 亿美元）的资金；这家瑞典投资公司的一位高管称，这一数额凸显了能源行业的资金需求如何战胜了不确定的交易市场。【原文：EQT AB has raised €21.5 billion ($23.2 billion) for its latest infrastructure fund — a sum a top executive for the Swedish investment firm says underscores how the energy sector’s funding needs trump an uncertain market for deals.】

item.title: 探险家寻求特朗普批准在太平洋海底开采金属
item.description: 一家海底采矿公司要求特朗普政府批准其在一个联合国下属组织控制的国际水域采集海底的关键金属。【原文：A seabed mining company has asked the Trump administration for approval to harvest the ocean floor for critical metals in international waters controlled by a United Nations-affiliated organization】

item.title: 法官裁定反对出售墨西哥湾石油钻探权
item.description: 一名联邦地区法官周四裁定，拜登政府出售墨西哥湾石油和天然气钻探权的交易无效，指责政府未能充分分析该交易可能对气候和濒危鲸鱼造成的影响。【原文：A federal district judge on Thursday ruled against a Biden administration sale of oil and gas drilling rights in the Gulf of Mexico, faulting the government with failing to sufficiently analyze its possible effects on the climate and endangered whales.】

item.title: 美国气象局合并办事处，人员编制压力增大
item.description: 美国国家气象局将合并一些最大的预报局，准备裁减多达 1000 名工作人员。【原文：The US National Weather Service will merge some of its largest forecasting bureaus as it prepares for the loss of as many as 1,000 staffers.】

item.title: 环保局通过电子邮件提供空气污染豁免途径
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，根据《清洁空气法》（Clean Air Act）的一项隐晦条款，美国环保署可能允许一些发电厂、化工厂和其他企业在数年内绕过一系列法规。【原文：US President Donald Trump may allow some power plants, chemical makers and others to bypass a range of regulations for years under an obscure provision of the Clean Air Act, the EPA said.】

item.title: 特朗普计划如何颠覆气候法规
item.description: 2009 年，美国环保署正式认定温室气体危害公众健康和福利。这一所谓的 "濒危结论 "成为一系列应对地球变暖污染的新规则的法律基础，也成为保守派试图扭转这些规则的长期目标。【原文：In 2009, the Environmental Protection Agency formally concluded that greenhouse gases jeopardize public health and welfare. This so-called endangerment finding became the legal foundation for a host of new rules combating planet-warming pollution – and a perennial target of conservative efforts to reverse them.】

item.title: 地球升温，北极海冰缩至冬季最低纪录
item.description: 本季北冰洋的冬季冰覆盖面积可能是有卫星记录以来 47 年中最小的，3 月 22 日达到峰值时，该地区的海冰覆盖面积仅为 553 万平方英里。【原文：The Arctic Ocean likely had the smallest winter ice cover in 47 years of satellite records this season, with just 5.53 million square miles of sea ice covering the region at its peak on March 22.】

item.title: 田纳西州在富国银行放弃净零目标后结束调查
item.description: 以田纳西州为首的一些州表示，在富国银行放弃遏制温室气体排放的目标后，该州结束了对富国银行气候工作的调查。【原文：A group of states led by Tennessee said it ended its investigation into Wells Fargo & Co.’s climate efforts after the lender ditched goals to curb greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 德国部长称特朗普关税不得削弱欧盟绿色目标
item.description: 即将离任的德国环境部长表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将对汽车进口征收 25% 的关税后，欧盟必须抵制为帮助汽车制造商而削弱气候目标的压力。【原文：The European Union must resist pressure to weaken climate targets in order to aid carmakers after US President Donald Trump said he would slap a 25% tariff on auto imports, Germany’s outgoing environment minister said.】

item.title: 法国太阳能行业组织称修订后的补贴削减仍会损害该行业
item.description: 法国的太阳能和可再生能源贸易游说团体表示，政府计划限制对家庭屋顶和车棚安装等中小型项目的补贴，这将损害就业，不管最近是否有修订。【原文：France’s solar and renewable trade lobbies said government plans to curb subsidies for small and medium-sized projects such as home-rooftop and carport installations will hurt jobs, regardless of recent revisions.】

item.title: 太阳能热潮引发转变，欧洲峰值电价承压
item.description: 当春季日照时间增加时，欧洲太阳能发电量的增加会推低白天的电价，从而产生一个也被称为倒峰值的洼地。【原文：When daylight hours increase in spring, increased solar production in Europe pushes down power prices during the day, creating a dip that’s also known as an inverted peak.】

item.title: Just Stop Oil 将停止破坏性抗议活动，声称英国取得了胜利
item.description: 气候抗议组织 "停止石油"（Just Stop Oil）表示，由于停止开采新石油和天然气的最初要求现已成为英国政府的政策，该组织将不再进行破坏性抗议活动。【原文：Climate protest group Just Stop Oil said it will no longer carry out disruptive protests as its initial demand to end new oil and gas is now government policy in the UK.】

item.title: 意大利和法国呼吁修改欧洲碳边境税
item.description: 意大利带头呼吁修改欧盟具有里程碑意义的碳边境税，以减轻成员国的行政负担，防止工业外流。【原文：Italy led calls for changes to the European Union’s landmark carbon border levy to reduce the administrative burden on member states and prevent an exodus of industries.】

item.title: 英国石油公司计划出售奥地利燃油零售点，包括电动汽车充电设施
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）计划在奥地利出售 260 多个燃油零售点，包括电动汽车充电资产，因为这家英国能源巨头正努力降低成本，提高回报。【原文：BP Plc plans to sell over 260 fuel-retail sites across Austria, including electric vehicle charging assets, as the UK energy giant seeks to reduce costs and boost returns.】

item.title: 环保运动组织 "阻止石油 "宣布结束直接行动
item.description: 环保运动组织 "正义停止石油 "宣布将停止直接行动，并声称已经赢得了停止开采新石油和天然气的要求。【原文：Environmental campaign group Just Stop Oil has announced it will stop direct action, claiming it has won its demand to end new oil and gas.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡的韦拉辛哈支持以债务换自然换取资金
item.description: 斯里兰卡中央银行行长 P. Nandalal Weerasinghe 说，债换自然可能是斯里兰卡债务重组后筹集资金的第一个机会。【原文：Debt-for-nature swaps could be Sri Lanka’s first opportunity to raise funds after restructuring its debt, the country’s central bank Governor P. Nandalal Weerasinghe said.】

item.title: S&P 500 财报电话会议上的气候讨论减少了四分之三
item.description: 在全美的董事会上，由于上市公司认为将自身与环境目标联系起来的收益较少，因此在收益电话会议上提及可持续发展和相关术语的次数急剧下降。【原文：In boardrooms across America, mentions of sustainability and related terms on earnings calls have dropped steeply as public companies see less to gain from associating themselves with environmental goals.】

item.title: 国际能源署署长呼吁日本重启休眠核电站
item.description: 国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）负责人表示，日本应加快努力，重启该国一些处于休眠状态的核电站，以满足日益增长的电力需求。【原文：Japan should accelerate its efforts to revive some of the country’s dormant nuclear power plants to meet growing demand for electricity, according to the head of the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 中国特使认为即使没有美国也能推进全球气候斗争
item.description: 中国最高气候特使表示，尽管美国第二次退出《巴黎协定》给应对全球变暖带来了前所未有的压力，但世界向清洁能源的转型仍将继续。【原文：China’s top climate envoy said the world’s transition to clean energy will continue, even as the US’s second withdrawal from the Paris Agreement puts unprecedented stress on the fight against global warming.】

item.title: 大西洋将迎来异常活跃的飓风季节
item.description: AccuWeather 公司称，今年大西洋将迎来又一个高于平均水平的飓风季节，多达六场风暴将影响美国。【原文：Another above-average hurricane season will threaten the Atlantic this year, with as many as six storms affecting the US, AccuWeather Inc. said.】

item.title: 核反应堆公司 Terrestrial Energy 将通过 SPAC 交易上市
item.description: 一家小型核反应堆开发商将通过一家特殊目的收购公司上市，该公司由前 Cantor Fitzgerald 首席执行官肖恩-马修斯（Shawn Matthews）领导。【原文：A developer of small nuclear reactors is going public via a special purpose acquisition company led by former Cantor Fitzgerald Chief Executive Officer Shawn Matthews.】

item.title: 如果航运规则刺激需求，雅苒准备生产更多氨气
item.description: 主要氨生产商雅苒国际股份公司（Yara International ASA）表示，如果全球航运业去碳化谈判提高了对无碳化学品的需求，该公司准备扩大产量。【原文：Major ammonia producer Yara International ASA said it’s ready to potentially expand output if global talks to decarbonize shipping raise demand for the carbon-free chemical.】

item.title: 巨灾专家利用人工智能应对飙升的保险损失
item.description:
每年 1500 亿美元的投保灾害损失已成为 "新常态"，保险公司希望技术能够帮助扭转这一趋势。【原文：

With annual insured disaster losses of $150 billion now “the new normal,” insurers are hoping technology can help turn the tide.

】
